NomaiObject:
<color=orange>Excavation Site</color>
1
COLEUS: Friends, with the new quantum rule Melorae has discovered, I believe we may be able to reach the <color=lightblue>Quantum Moon</color> at last!
2
1
MELORAE: Of note, Coleus: though we may be able to enter the <color=lightblue>Quantum Moon,</color> it may still prove a challenge to reach a wandering celestial body with our shuttles.
3
2
MELORAE: We should appoint a set of eyes to remain at the <color=orange>Quantum Moon Locator</color> to track the planet it is orbiting at all times. That way, we could calculate a shuttle's flight without worry of it orbiting a different planet!
4
3
PLUME: That is a wise idea, Melorae. I shall seek a wise set of eyes to remain at the <color=orange>Quantum Moon Locator</color> on <color=lightblue>Brittle Hollow</color> when we next return.
5
3
COLEUS: I agree! Though, it may be difficult to find someone willing to bear the scorching heat at the <color=orange>Quantum Moon Locator</color> on <color=lightblue>Ember Twin's</color> surface...
6
4
MELORAE: Plume, we were referring to the locator on <color=lightblue>Ember Twin's south pole..</color> Is there a second <color=orange>Quantum Moon Locator</color> on <color=lightblue>Brittle Hollow</color> as well?
7
6
PLUME: Oh? Yes, the Nomai on <color=lightblue>Brittle Hollow</color> built a locator some time ago to track the <color=lightblue>Quantum Moon..</color> How amusing that our friends on <color=lightblue>Ember Twin</color> would have the same idea.
8
7
MELORAE: How fascinating! Perhaps we should visit this <color=orange>Second Locator</color> together when we next return to <color=lightblue>Brittle Hollow,</color>, Plume. I am quite curious how different it is from our locator!
Workshop R3 8
